page.title: 11A DAY ON MISS BROWNS FARM
page.content: {Miss Brown}wakes at 6 O'clock, listens to the{farming}programme on the radio, rises at 6_30, and then has breakfast. After the necessary house chores, she then feeds the various houses of hens, ducks,geese and peacocks. She then prepares the food for the cows and lets them into their boxes containing the calves which are being reared either for the beef market or to be retained for herd replacement.The remainder of the morning is occasionally taken up by hand sowing grass seed to supplement a rather poor pasture. Late in the afternoon, the chickens are fed and the eggs are collected. After tea,the cows and calves have to be fed again;then at dusk the poultry have to be shut up to prevent the foxes in the area from making a meal of them.
